Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • GeometricFigure
      • Rectangle

  • public class Rectangle
extends GeometricFigure
    This class represents a two dimensional rectangle defined by two point, they represent (x min, y min) and (x max, y max), respectively, representing the coordinates of rectangle's diagonal.
    Since:
    13/11/2016
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andre Pedro, Ricardo Reais, Vasco Carvalho
    See Also:
    GeometricFigure, Point, LineSegment

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Point a
      The Point a can be considered the start and b the end point, both points connected form the line segment that represents the diagonal of the rectangle.
      private Point b
      The Point a can be considered the start and b the end point, both points connected form the line segment that represents the diagonal of the rectangle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rectangle(Point a, Point b)
      The creation of a valid rectangle implies that the start and end points of the diagonal must be different, or else we would only have one simple point.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected double area()
      Computes the area of the rectangle using: height * length.
      double diagonalLength()
      Computes the distance between the two opposite vertices of the rectangle.
      Point getEnd() 
      Point getStart() 
      double height()
      Computes the height of the rectangle.
      protected boolean intersects(LineSegment ls)
      Checks if a rectangle intersects a line segment, using the intersection between two line segments in all of the rectangle's edges.
      double length()
      Computes the length of the rectangle.
      protected double perimeter()
      Computes the perimeter of the rectangle using: 2*height + 2*length.
      void setEnd(Point b)
      Defines the outermost ending point of the rectangle's diagonal.
      void setStart(Point a)
      Defines the outermost starting point of the rectangle's diagonal.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the object.

        public Rectangle(Point a,

        Parameters:
        a - Rectangle diagonal start point.
        b - Rectangle diagonal end point.

      • intersects

        protected boolean intersects(LineSegment ls)
        Checks if a rectangle intersects a line segment, using the intersection between two line segments in all of the rectangle's edges.
        Specified by:
        intersects in class GeometricFigure
        Parameters:
        ls - Line segment to check the intersection.
        Returns:
        True if the rectangle and the segment intersect, else false.
        See Also:
